document.docTitle: Eratigena laksao Bolzern & Jäger, 2015, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Unexpected occurrence of the genus Eratigena in Laos with description of a new species (Araneae: Agelenidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Unexpected occurrence of the genus Eratigena in Laos with description of a new species (Araneae: Agelenidae)

tr.th: Type material. Holotype ♂: Laos, Bolikhamsay Prov.,
cave and cave entrance, at day, by hand, 9.XI.2009, P.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratype ♂: Laos , Bolikhamsay Prov., Lak Sao, Tham Man Kone,
N 18 ° 13 ’ 16.1 ”
,
E 104 ° 48 ’ 45.9 ”
, 501 m , inside cave, at day, by hand,
27 .XI. 2012
, P. Jäger ( SMF ; GenBank accession number
LK 996041
).

Additional material. Same data as holotype ,
1 subadult
female. Same data as paratype ,
2 juveniles
.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality and can be translated as “kilometre 20 ”, referring to the distance of the town from the Vietnamese border.

Diagnosis. Male
E. laksao
sp. n.
resemble those of
E. vomeroi
,
E. inermis
, and
E. sicana (Brignoli, 1976 )
in having distinctly annulated legs (
Figs 1–4
; all other species pale, completely darkened or only basally annulated legs). They differ from those and all other species in having a median apophysis lacking a distinct distal sclerite (
Figs 14 –14
,
19– 20
), and an RTA with bristles (
Figs 14 –18, 21
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 14–15.
Eratigena laksao
sp. n.
14. Left palp in ventral view (male holotype). 15. Same, retrolateral view. Abbreviations: Br = bristles; C = conductor; dRTA = dorsal branch of RTA; E = embolus; MA = median apophysis; R = membranous ridge; RTA = retrolateral tibial apophysis; vRTA = ventral branch of RTA.

FIGURES 16–21.
Eratigena laksao
sp. n.
, male holotype. 16. Left palp, prolateral view. 17. Same, ventral view. 18. Same, retrolateral view. 19. Bulb of left palp, ventral view. 20. Same, retrolateral view. 21. Palpal tibia, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male. Measurements: Male ( holotype larger than paratype ; only carapace and abdomen measured for both): carapace length 3.98–4.60 , width 2.92–3.49 , abdomen length 3.94–4.73 , width 1.83–2.93 , sternum length 2.13 , width 1.98 . Leg I (femur: 8.94 , patella: 1.63 , tibia: 8.81 , metatarsus: 10.90 , tarsus: 6.20 ), II ( 7.11 , 1.63 , 6.59 , 8.44 , 4.14 ), III ( 7.23 , 1.50 , 6.02 , 8.56 , 3.40 ), IV ( 9.12 , 1.66 , 7.83 , 12.80 , 4.92 ). Pedipalp ( 1.96 , 0.86 , 1.04 , 2.26 ), bulb 1.15 . Eyes: PME 0.238 , PLE 0.293 , AME 0.249 , ALE 0.279 . Eye distances: PME–PME 0.5 x PME, PME–AME 0.5 x PME, PME–PLE < 0.5 x PME, PME–ALE
1 x
PME, AME–AME << 0.5 x AME, AME–ALE << 0.5 x AME. CLY 1
2 x
AME, CLY 2
0.5– 1
x ALE.
Distribution. Reported from two caves in Bolikhamsay Province, Laos .
